Builds SSH connections.

Constant Field Values

PRIVATE_KEY_FILE

public static final java.lang.String PRIVATE_KEY_FILE
Name of the connection option used to specify the private key file to use. N.B.: Private keys cannot be used when the SSH connection type is INTERACTIVE_SUDO because the password is needed for the password prompts.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

PASSPHRASE

public static final java.lang.String PASSPHRASE
Name of the connection option use to specify the passphrase of the private key.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ALLOCATE_DEFAULT_PTY

public static final java.lang.String ALLOCATE_DEFAULT_PTY
Name of the connection option used to specify whether a default pty (dummy:80:24:0:0) should be allocated when executing a command. All sudo implementations require it for interactive sudo, some even require it for normal sudo. Some SSH server implementations (notably OpenSSH on AIX 5.3) crash when it is allocated.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ALLOCATE_DEFAULT_PTY_DEFAULT

public static final boolean ALLOCATE_DEFAULT_PTY_DEFAULT
Default value of the connection option used to specify whether a default pty should be allocated when executing a command.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ALLOCATE_PTY

public static final java.lang.String ALLOCATE_PTY
Name of the connection option used to specify a specific pty that should be allocated when executing a command. The format is TERM:COLS:ROWS:WIDTH:HEIGTH e.g. xterm:80:24:0:0. If null or an empty string is specified, no pty is allocated. Overrides the ALLOCATE_DEFAULT_PTY option.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ALLOCATE_PTY_DEFAULT

public static final java.lang.String ALLOCATE_PTY_DEFAULT
Default value (null) of the connection option used to specify a specific pty that should be allocated when executing a command.

SUDO_USERNAME

public static final java.lang.String SUDO_USERNAME
Name of the connection option used to specify the username to sudo to for SUDO and INTERACTIVE_SUDO SSH connections.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

SUDO_COMMAND_PREFIX

public static final java.lang.String SUDO_COMMAND_PREFIX
Name of the connection option used to specify the sudo command to prefix. The placeholder {0} is replaced with the value of SUDO_USERNAME.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

SUDO_COMMAND_PREFIX_DEFAULT

public static final java.lang.String SUDO_COMMAND_PREFIX_DEFAULT
Default value of the connection option used to specify the sudo command to prefix.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

SUDO_QUOTE_COMMAND

public static final java.lang.String SUDO_QUOTE_COMMAND
Name of the connection option used to specify whether or not to quote the original command when it is prefixed with SUDO_COMMAND_PREFIX.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

SUDO_QUOTE_COMMAND_DEFAULT

public static final boolean SUDO_QUOTE_COMMAND_DEFAULT
Default value of the connection option used to specify whether or not to quote the original command.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

SUDO_OVERRIDE_UMASK

public static final java.lang.String SUDO_OVERRIDE_UMASK
Name of the connection option used to specify whether or not to explicitly change the permissions with chmod -R go+rX after uploading a file or directory with scp.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

SUDO_OVERRIDE_UMASK_DEFAULT

public static final boolean SUDO_OVERRIDE_UMASK_DEFAULT
Default value of the connection option used to specify whether or not to explicitly change the permissions with go+rX after uploading a file with scp.

See Also:

Method Detail

connect

public OverthereConnection connect()
Description copied from interface: OverthereConnectionBuilder
Creates the connection that corresponds to the arguments that were passed in the two-arg constructor of this class. The first argument is a String that specifies the type (and is identical to the name field of the Protocol annotation). The second argument is the ConnectionOptions.

Specified by:
connect in interface OverthereConnectionBuilder
Returns:
the created connection.

public java.lang.String toString()
